Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: Applications are free to serialize policies in any format. This section of the specification defines a recommended standard syntax for policy files based on s-expressions.

Subsection.title: Medrina
Subsection.Paragraph: Policy files should begin with a medrina expression stating the major and minor version of the language used to express the policy.

Subsection.title: Subject Match
Subsection.Paragraph: Subject match expressions are expressed with the following syntax:

FormalItem.title: Subject Match
FormalItem.Verbatim:
matchSubjectE = "true" | "false" | "(" , "with-all-roles" , name* , ")" | "(" , "with-any-roles" , name* , ")" | "(" , "or" , matchSubjectE , matchSubjectE , ")" | "(" , "and" , matchSubjectE , matchSubjectE , ")" ;
matchSubject = "(" , "subject" , matchSubjectE , ")" ;

FormalItem.title: Subject Match (Example)
FormalItem.Verbatim: (subject [and (or [with-any-roles x y z] [with-all-roles a b]) (or true false)])

Subsection.title: Object Match
Subsection.Paragraph: Object match expressions are expressed with the following syntax:

FormalItem.title: Object Match
FormalItem.Verbatim:
matchObjectE = "true" | "false" | "(" , "with-type" , name , ")" | "(" , "or" , matchObjectE , matchObjectE , ")" | "(" , "and" , matchObjectE , matchObjectE , ")" ;
matchObject = "(" , "object" , matchObjectE , ")" ;

Subsection.title: Action Match
Subsection.Paragraph: Action match expressions are expressed with the following syntax:

FormalItem.title: Action Match
FormalItem.Verbatim:
matchActionE = "true" | "false" | "(" , "with-name" , name , ")" | "(" , "or" , matchActionE , matchActionE , ")" | "(" , "and" , matchActionE , matchActionE , ")" ;
matchAction = "(" , "action" , matchActionE , ")" ;

Subsection.title: Rules
Subsection.Paragraph: Rules are expressed with the following syntax:

FormalItem.title: Rule (Example)
FormalItem.Verbatim: (deny (subject [and (or [with-any-roles x y z] [with-all-roles a b]) (or true false)]) (object [and (or [with-type a] [with-type b]) (or true false)]) (action [and (or [with-name a] [with-name b]) (or true false)]))
